transcript.content: The Cardigans - For What It's Worth
(Easy Listening DJ Voice) Oooh, chilly weather, why not put on a cardigan?
(Easy Listening DJ Voice) That was The Cardigans.
(Easy Listening DJ Voice) And "For What It's Worth". A lovely tune there. (Normal Voice) Uhh--
We should definitely talk like that more often.
XFM 104.9. Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. All right?
Well, we got a jam-packed show today--
We got- we got- awww- we got so many feat- we got more features than Karl's got on his face--
(Laughing Slightly) Which is- which is about the same as Morph.
Very few. It's just- it's just really a head, innit? The little--
That's where I've seen him before!
Umm, we've got, uhh, "Rockbusters". That's- that's--
Aw, you know my feelings on that but fair enough.

No, but he's- he's gonna- he's said he's gonna, um, buck his ideas up. We've got "Oooh Chimpanzee That!" - Karl finds a- a- an amusing, uh, monkey or ape-related story. Umm, we've got, uhh, "Karl in a Film" again.
Right. Excellent. Yeah, we've got a lot of great response from that, Karl, on the internet and on the email--
It was my favorite thing that we've done.
So, what, uh- can we say what the film is that we--
And 'scuse mah French, we've got some bloody great music.
(Laughs Slightly) Ahhh. P- pardonnez moo- moi... I don't know, I can't speak French--
Well, I'll just give you a taster: we've got Oasis, Cardigans which you've just heard there, we've got Lloyd Cole, we got a bit of Pretenders coming up, Eminem, Feeder, Coldplay, all the greats.
Can I play some Teenage Fan Club later, Rick?
Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah. What should we have now?
Oasis and "Songbird". That's a nice little ditty.

XFM 104.9. Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. I- I think we should go straight into it, Karl. I think you should- we should, uh, do the competition, the- the, uh, "There's Karl in the Corner" or whatever.
It seems a little premature, don't you think?
We should- we should tease it out a little.
Well, it's a big- it's a big thing.
It's just that I've got absolutely nothing to say. I've--
Well, I mean, I- often you'll have spoken to Karl in the week. This week, for some reason I've been speaking to him.
I spoke briefly to him about Michael Jackson... and the documentary.
Now, of course I thought that was extraordinary--
And, uh, I asked Karl for his opinion.
And he didn't mention to me, uh, the fact that Michael Jackson likes to climb up in trees--
He didn't mention anything about his bizarre relationship with children, he didn't mention anything about his obsessive billionaire spending sprees--

He didn't spend- mention anything about the, uhh, mannequins he has in his thing or the fact that he drives around his- his, sort of, seven hotel suites in Las Vegas in a little, kind of, old people's scooter. The first- the only thing of note, for Karl, was- he said to me, "Did you notice how big his hands are?"
I'll tell you what, though... I did.
WHAT- ya- how are you looking at- the man's got... like, a face that he's had reconst- well--
I can't- seems so- that's libelous--
But he's got an awful... face.
He hasn't. Yeah, he's had two- he's had two nose jobs. Yeah.
And you're looking at his hands?!

But I think it's because you look at him and he looks a bit like... it- it- there's a bit of androgyny there but it's, sort of, like a... it is quite a, um, petite, sort of, old lady's face, in a way. But then you see these (Laughing Slightly) laborer's hands come out. That's always the way with a tranny, innit? You know what I mean?
What you c- can't accuse him of being a tranny!!!
No, he's not! No, I'm- no he's not a tran--
He's got enough issues, now you're accusing him of being a tranny!

I like him. I thought he came out of that brilliant. I- I thought he was really- I really felt sorry for him, ehm, and, uh- no, I think it- he cleared up a few things as far as I'm concerned. I thought it was a fascinating piece of work. But, umm, I- I did like the shopping spree, that was great.
He was going around just pointing--
Because he's got such bad taste.
I know, it was bad taste, wasn't it? It was like one of those bizarre shops--
You know what I mean? Those anything- sort of, gift shop but they're trying to make it look like Ming.
But if he'd- yeah, if he'd--
If he'd been living in a trailer park he'd of been ordering, you know, one of those, uh, porcelain dolls dressed like a Harley-Davidson bike rider--
Or, you know, an Elvis commemorative plate.
It was, kind of, the billionaire equivalent of that.
But the hands were a giveaway. It's the same as those, sort of--
What do you mean, "the hands were a giveaway"?! What--
What was it about his hands?! I didn't even see his hands.
Well, you know when you get, like, a cab driver or sommat, right, and he- he decides to go- turn transsexual about 60 and he goes on "Kilroy"...

Do you know what I mean? It's that way. And he got a twin set and high heels and he goes, (Husky Voice) "I've never felt so comfortable." But his hands are still big, he's got a little wig and he's got the lipstick on and he's with his teenage kids who are going, "Kill me." But it's--
Do you think he's been having surgery on his hands to make them larger?
Is that why he was wearing that glove through most of the '80s?
Exactly. Because he's get- I think he wants to be a goalkeeper.
And they said, "You- you can't, Michael. You gotta have big hands."
It would help him climb the trees.
It is- it is- (Laughs Slightly) yeah, yeah. And he can play tennis now without a racket.
So, what did you make of it, Karl? Were you intrigued?
It was- you know, it was all right but, umm... like, that got a load of attention in the press but the Tricia program got nothing.
I know- like, Steve called me up in the week, right, uhh, like, 10 o'clock in the morning and I was at work--
It was a big show at 10 o'clock- it was a big...
Most people go to work about 8 or 9.
"Are you watchin' 'Tricia' and that?" I said, "No, what is it?" He goes, "Aw, you'll be lovin' it", right. Uhhmm--
Freaks? Was it f-f- "Help Me, My Mum's a Freak"?
So, I couldn't watch it but he said, "Oh, it might be on again cuz they repeat stuff on ITV 2."
So, I- I had me dinner late--
Instead of having it at, like, 1 o'clock like I normally do--
Sat in the office, put the telly on, ITV2. Ehhm, these Siamese twins--
It was amazing... You know, we talk about a lot of things on the show quite a lot - the hairy kids crop up a lot.
(Laughing) I was waitin'! It's been 10 minutes and you haven't mentioned the hairy kid.
Right? And, uhh, last week we were talking about Siamese twins, weren't we?
So, it was- it was weird that this program was on. But, it was amazing... I mean, what- what--
I think you can't refer to them as "Siamese twins" I think they're known as "conjoined twins".
I think- I think "Siamese" is maybe considered derogatory or as an old antiquated phrase.
Yeah, I think it's cuz the first famous ones were actually from Siam.
(Laughing Slightly) And- and that doesn't exist anymore!
But you'd think that if that's happened to ya... that wouldn't be that, sort of, offensive. The names that you must get called...
(Laughing Slightly) Right. You think that's the least of your worries?
"Siamese twins" I'd say- well, that's... yeah, least of your worries.
Now, were you stunned by where--
(Laughing Slightly) "Just live with it", you'd say. Ri--
Because they were connected, of course, at- at the forehead.
Sort of- which was quite- quite extraordinary.
God. What if one had bad breath?
I d- that wasn't a question that Tricia asked.
Annoyingly, cuz I know that much of the audience was thinking that.
There was- there was a few things that didn't crop up.
What questions would you of asked of them? Cuz- what things did you feel weren't mentioned?
I'd love to just watch Karl watching amazing things!
Do you know what I mean? It's like- like t- early learning.
Like, mouth slightly open- just a slight- slight--
Yeah mouth open, slight dribble, (Gasps) looking 'round to see if anyone else has seen it.
(Laughing Slightly) The way a cat sees a bird on the balcony.
(Laughing Slightly) It can't believe its luck.
I'd probably say, "How do you buy her a- like, a birthday present?"
Right? Umm, I'd probably ask, uhh--
Well, did you not think it was interesting that one of them had a boyfriend?
Well, that was a bit weird, wasn't it?
But, uhhm, what was the other thing that I was thinking when I was watching it?... Was thinking if one got into crime and was sent to prison...
(Laughing) It's brilliant! It is brilliant. If a chimp could talk...
And, uhh, what was the other one? The other thing was, uhhm, what do they talk about? Because it's not as if you can say, "Oooh, you'll never guess what I did today."
Do you know what I mean?
Ricky and Steve Continue to Laugh
Ricky and Steve Continue to Laugh
(Easy Listening DJ Voice) Ehhh, "Brass in Pocket" and if, uhhh, they're pretending to be good, they're doing a bloody good job of it.
(Easy Listening DJ Voice) I love them. That's Ricky Gervais on XFM 104.9. With me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Karl is still buzzing about these conjoined twins.
One of them of course, had to be- because one of them was, sort of, shorter than the other and had to be, sort of, wheeled around on a kind of trolley... thing by--
By the other- by the other--
This isn't Molly and Dolly, is it?
No, they're not called- one's called Reba--
And I forget what the other one's called. Shena maybe or something like that.
Do you- do you remember Karl?
No, I wasn't that impressed with their names.
Yeah. So you immediately put them out of your mind.
"Those are rubbish names! Daaaah, forget it, forget it. Karl, forget it!"
Alright cuz I saw sommat- I've seen some Americans on Jerry Springer.
Well, bizarrely, one of them was apparently a country music star...
Well, they're not called Molly and Dolly!
The one that joined at the oi- the one that joined--
But they're not- I think you've made up the "Molly and Dolly".
No, it was on "Jerry Springer". There's a little one that sits on a seat and the other one carries it around- her around, (Laughs Slightly) uhh, and--
They're not called Molly and Dolly.
They're called- well we know that one of them's called Reba and I forget the other name.
(Laughing Slightly) And one of them's a country and western singer or sommat.
Yeah, and one of- but she was saying, "Yeah, I've just made a movie... It's coming out shortly in theaters."
Yeah, and the other one said, "Oh, I'm not involved."
I d- it- utterly bizarre. Cuz they- they live their- they work so hard to live their lives seperately--
Yeah, they say it's a- exactly, of course, yeah.
It's all- you know, they try not to- so... so, she's talking about her music career and the other one's, sort of, not taking any, kind of, credit for it - which is nice, I suppose.
It's weird, though. Cuz when she was singing as well, the other one just stands there, she doesn't join in, she doesn't, sort of, dance--
Do you know what I mean? Make a group out of it.
Yeah, well... But it seems like we're, sort of, bein' horrible but we're not--
I mean, it's a really bad thing but--
No- no, we- we're laughing at Karl's amazement--
At- at this phenomenon. Sorry, I- we- I just got to say that we're not- we're not, you know--
The really weird thing about all this, right?
And it's annoying because you were saying about, you know, "Ooh, what should Tricia of asked?" and all that.
But one of 'em mentioned, ehhm, that one of 'em was adopted and the other one wasn't.
No, seriously... I didn't understand it, right--
And then Tricia, sort of, said, "Well, let's have a chat-" and- and they were like, "No. Don't want to go into that."
What do you mean "one was adopted and one wasn't"?
That's what they said. One of 'em...
I don't- don't quiz me on it but that- that's--
What was- that's what was said.
"And I've- I've just seen your orphanage--"
"And I'd like to adopt one of your children."
"Because I've got loads from around the world--"
"So I'd love to adopt one. I'll give you ten thousand towards your, uhh, your orphanage."
"Oooh, well- well we'll speed it through, then. Yeah, yeah."
"I only need one." I'm only interested in one.
"Yeah, I don't need any more. Don't need any more."
"I know it would be tragedy to break them up but I really only need one."
"Well, 'break it up' - there's the... there's the rub, you see."
"I just need the one. Here's ten thousand dollars now, you can have that, I'll sign it now, but I don't want to discuss it further."
"Okay, I'll bring her 'round- I'll bring her 'round."
"Hi. Yeah, brilliant. You've brought my kid around."
"Yeah, do you wanna- can you bring her out toward me- it's like- so I--"
"No, there's n- there's nothing behind the bush so just- you just want--"
"I just want- I wanna- I just wanna be able to walk 360 degrees around her."
Eminem - Sing for the Moment (Dream On) Begins To Play
Eminem - Sing for the Moment (Dream On)
Feeder - Just The Way I'm Feelin'
Feeder... That's it: "Just The Way I'm Feelin'". XFM 104.9. Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. It's time for the- the newest quiz in town.

This is where... Karl inserts himself into a seminal film. Last week, uhm, it was the little kid in "Sixth Sense", you remember, to, uh, great acclaim. The critics loved it, they said, "a triumph." Uhh, this week, he's fiddled with "The Graduate". Uhm, this is the scene where, of course, uh, uh, he goes upstairs to the hotel room and, um, he's, uh- it's- it's on the cards, she's a dead cert, Mrs. Robinson.
There you go, then. So, uh, are you ready for it? I've, uhh, brought some condoms from home that, uh, Suzanne got for Christmas--
Will you bring me a hanger?
I'll tell you what, I've, uhh- ... I've got wood.
Just sayin' I've, uhh- I've got wood. I've got metal ones as well, what- what sort do you want?

UHHHH, no. No, I've- I've seen weirder things than you. Uh, have I ever told you about the- the two lads I went to school with who had big heads? .... Webbed fingers as well, not related and, uhh, weren't mates. But, both had the same thing which was a bit- bit weird... Uhh, yeah, I di- I've never found out what was wrong with 'em.
Can I ask you a personal question?
As long as it's not about me head bein' round cuz Ricky's always going on about that... Sayin' I've got a round head.
Well you can admit that, can't you?
No, it's- it's- I'd say it's a normal, sort of, shape, it's just round.
Yeah, but what- what- what do you mean? So is yours. Heads should be round.
It's nothing to be ashamed of!
I'm not ashamed, it's... just a normal shape!
And you can talk - look at your saggy arse!
Simon and Garfunkel - The Sound of Silence Begins To Play
Simon and Garfunkel - The Sound of Silence Fades Out
It was an absolute treat. Now, I should say that obviously, uhh, the prize is a copy of "The Graduate". Now bear in mind that XFM is giving away these prizes...

Karl is so cheap, that he wouldn't even buy it on DVD. He's bought it for 6.99 on VHS, it'll be panned and scanned, it won't be widescreen, there's none of the extra features that you get on the DVD. That's how cheap he is!
Ohh, look at Karl's face! He's gutted!
Karl, did you pocket the rest of the cash?
No, no, I have to use me own money to buy these, right--
What, you're using your own money to give this stuff away?
Yeah. So I had to go and buy that.
XFM is so cheap! I'm stunned!
Right, and, uhh, it's not worth havin' it on DVD, is it?
Cuz it's- it's an old film, so--
So the quality is- is set, do you know what I mean? They can't really tidy it up.
(Laughing) Of course they can! They do it from a print, they don't do it from the video. They don't get- they don't get the video and go, "Let's make it into a DVD".
It's the same film though, innit?
Fine, okay, well you're right, yeah.
It is the same film, yeah.
Well anyway, you can win, uh, 6.99's worth of "The Graduate"--

The question- and it's email only: ste- uh, ste? It's not Steve, it's [email protected] The question is: "Name the actor that Karl, uh, was taking the place of in the film and, of course, the actress that he's performing opposite." [email protected]
Do you wanna play something from the...
Simon and Garfunkel - Sound of Silence
(Easy Listening DJ Voice) Dear Mr. Simon and Mr. Garfunkel, please let's not have the sound of silence, let's have some more beautiful music. Get back together please, quickly.
I think you should do every single link like that.
Bri- it's the best bit of the show.
Uhhh, that's on XFM 104.9. Well there ya go--
Are we gonna have time to play the clip again before, uhh, I don't know- before 2:00, let's say?
Are people not listening to the question? Is that what you--
Some people are not listening to the question.
Oh, dear. Okay, well we'll play it again about 2, then.
And, personally, any excuse to hear it again cuz I thought it was a treat.
I think- I think Karl should go out and get the DVD.
I think it's embarrassing to give away the, uhh, VHS--
Yeah, you have to get it. You have to go out and buy the DVD later.
Karl, on the DVD it's got a booklet, it's got an audio commentary, it's got behind the scenes features and it's got a pristine, widescreen version of the film. You've got some cheap 6.99 version--
And so, because you were mean, cuz it was your own money, you're gonna have to- you're gonna have to waste that now--
Cuz no one wants it. So, it's gonna cost you twice as much as it would have done if you just got the DVD the first time 'round.
There's a penalty if you've not. No, you haven't rewound it!
Go and get the DVD later. This- the- they're gonna win the DVD.
No, I looked at the DVD and it was 18 quid and--
I'm not payin' 18 quid for the--
What a cheap station this is.
Well, do you wanna go on with the other prizes with, uhh- what we're giving away later?
We don't give away prizes, we throw away prizes.
(Laughing Slightly) Yeah, it is- we're cleaning out.
Cleaning out some drawers at XFM.
I'm just havin' a quick look through before I--
Cuz we've sort of revamped "Rockbusters" a bit, there's that extra bit in it now, in't they? That audio bit.
You're selling it. You're- big- big sell.
Aw, we're not going straight into that, though.
There's a DVD there. There's a DVD.
There's a DVD there. What's that?
I'll- I'll go through them later, Rick. I just need to absorb it.
So, uh, who did, uh, Karl play in the clip? What actor's place did he, uh, take and what actress played opposite him? Uhm, that's ricky.gervais--
What have we got coming up? We've got some--
Just, uh, play a bit of Coldplay?
Bit of Coldplay would be all right.
Coldplay, "Yellow" on XFM 104.9. Get it on DVD! It's an embarrassment. Seven quid's worth of old video pan-and-scanned.
I bought it, now. That's what they're getting. Right--
It put a downer on it. All the work, you know, that went into that and then just gonna fob 'em off with a bit of old celluloid like that.
Well, listen, still to come, right...
We've got, ehhhm, the- the monkey s- thing.
And when I was out last Sunday, right, at Johnny's birthday party--
Got talkin' about stuff. Ehm, and a debate... that we didn't really finish... cropped up.
It blew your mind, didn't it?

Oh, I know about this. Steve told me. This is the, uh, infinite amount of monkeys, uhm, or a monkey with a typewriter and an infinite amount of time would eventually come up with the works of Shakespeare.
There was no debate. It's a philosophical, mathematical problem. There's no debate. It's true.

No, listen Karl, listen. Infinity sorts it all out for ya... right. An infinite amount of monkeys at a typewriter, right- they would do- they would do everything. They'd type everything. Infinity just sorts it all out for ya. There's no gettin' to it and they're going, "Oh, well, let's have a look what they've done. This one's come close - he has 'Romeo and Juliop".
It would do it all. It would type everything ever possible, conceivable. It--
Well, we've heard your side of the argument, Rick--
And I'll be honest with you, it's a persuasive one. But, let's hear Karl--
Because he heard about this in a pub last week--
So, he's got some strong ideas himself.
What's your problem with it? What's your problem with it?
Well, f- first of all, right, you're saying it's a load of monkeys, it's not just one monkey that's- that can live forever.

It depends. It- no, no, no, wait, wait... It's either a- a chimpanzee with a typewriter with an infinite amount of time, he would eventually, by definition, mathematically, type everything ever possible, okay, or it's an infinite amount of m- uhm, uh, chimps with typewriters and one of them will type it first time.
But already that's- that's, sort of... That's not right. You either need to have one--
What do you mean, "it's not right"?!
With a typewriter that's got loads of ink in it and that, right, at least it knows what it's done in the past...
If you got a load of monkeys- it's like- it's like if you have too many- what's that saying about "too many chefs spoil the--"

Right, well it's the same thing. It's like, "Well I didn't tell ya to put salt in it. I was gonna put salt in it." and it messes it up. Whereas if it's just one, they know what's gone on. So what I'm saying is--
I want to hear- I want to hear the rest.
I- i- this blows my mind. He doesn't know what this does to me. It's a mathematical problem--
I want to hear the rest.
Well, it's just- I just don't think it will happen.
What do you mean you don't think it would happen? Infinity works it out for ya. By definition!
Well, what's stopping them typing the same thing again?

They would. They'd- in fact, the problem should be, if you have an infinite amount, uh, uh, of time that, um, it would type the works of Shakespeare an infinite amount of times and everything else an infinite amount of times. But, you know, that's not- that's just- that's- that's not as--
You know- Rick, do you know what he said to me? I said to him, uh- I explained it to him, I said--
"You've got an infinite number of monkeys, infinite number of typewriters, they will type the complete works of Shakespeare."
YOU'RE AN IDIOT! Play a record because I'm not having this conversation.
I said, "No, they're not doing it from memory--"
I'm not havin' it because it (Slapping the Desk) really, really winds me up.
But you're saying they'll do it with no spelling errors?

Wh- they'll do it a- a- they'll do it an infinite amount of times. And they'll do it- they'll do it wrong an infinite amount of times. And they'll do it- and they'll spell, uhh, the last full stop, uhh, wrong an infinite amount of times and they'll do it- and they'll get one thing wrong in "Hamlet" wrong an infinite amount of times. They'll do everything an infinite amount of times.
But are they going off a story that they've already--
PLAY A RECORD, Karl because I'm gonna knock you out!
Lloyd Cole - She's a Girl and I'm a Man Begins to Play
Oh, Christ. Right, okay, shut up--
Lloyd Cole - She's a Girl and I'm a Man
Lloyd Cole, "She's a Girl and I'm a Man". Good that, innit?
On XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. Yeah.
As ever, Rick, there's always someone who steps in to defend Karl...
I- (Sighs) okay, what is the defense?

Here's a- an email from Scott Kumer, he says, "Karl is actually right. I've got an A-level in statistics and probability. It doesn't matter how long they have and how many monkeys you have you cannot guarantee they will type the complete works of Shakespeare. Infinity makes it probable they would- they would get it right but not definite."
Yeah. That's what I was saying.
No. No, you weren't saying, Karl. You don't understand it. Infinity, sort of, sorts it out that if they d- if they do- if they do anything, they're- they're nearly do everything, won't they?
No, I mean, they'll give it a good shot and that--
No, that's not the point. But, the point is this--
I'd be surprised if they did one page right.
It's not to do with consciousness, it's not to do with them aiming, it's--
They are just bashing away at the keyboard.
It's like- it's like they're- they're used to show that there isn't consciousness. They- they- they chose the chimpanzee because it can type, presumably, at the keyboard--
It's because- it's because they hadn't come across you at the time.
(Laughing) Yeah. Yeah, it's to take out thought- out of it. It's to take out reason and trying, right--

It's just random. They're saying that if you typed enough things- if a computer was left s- "Type in everything"... If you left it for an infinite amount of time- and they chose Shakespeare because there is meaning behind it and it's difficult to get it exactly right to show you that... infinity would... come up with a s- it's not just Shakespeare, it's every novel. It's everything.
Fairly eloquent there from Gervais. A quick riposte please, from Karl Pilkington.
No, I'm just sayin'... what I don't understand, if it hasn't read it--
Then how does it know where it's going?
OHHH! I d- listen, right, o- okay listen, right I- I can't--
Can I- can I just intervene?
Can I just explain to people, right, some people have said, "Oh, why are you cruel to Karl?" He drives me mental with things like that.
Can I just- well let me just- just--
You just take a breather for a moment--
(Laughing Slightly) How do I do your head in?
He keeps coming in in the week--
You know that I work here properly in--
I've got a proper job. Yeah?
Should be 9 to 5 but I normally get in about 8 o'clock and work 'til--
A lot of people get in at 8 o'clock.
Working hard, trying to do me job...
Three times this week I've been rushin' around, I walk past me little studio, he's sat in there, all right?
Now, because I've got this sort of job, I can get away with it. I said to him, "If I was a doctor--"
Would he keep coming to me practice?
If you were a doctor, there'd be severe problems with the NHS.
The standards would have lowered so much to "if you can arrive at the hospital, you're a doctor."
We go to lunch! When I pop in we got to lunch, don't we? We have a little lunch break, don't we?
I go, "Come on, let's go", "No", he goes, "I'm busy", I go, "Come on, let's go", he goes, "Aw, you're doing me head in."
Well, when I was talking about the monkey conundrum with Karl he said to me, "Right, if I had a day of work and I was, say, watching the TV and with one hand I was typing at a typewriter--"
Yeah, but you see there's certain things- we were talking a little bit about this stuff the other week, weren't we, when we said, uhh--
You were going on about Einstein and I said, "He's not that good." Uhm...
You know, "E equals mc squared, you know, it sounds good but I've never used it and that, right?"
(Laughing) "I've never used it"! You haven't used two and two equals four, Karl!
The fella with an apple fell on his head... you know, it could have been anyone sittin' under that tree.
(Sarcastic Voice) And- and Newton gets all--
(Laughing) And just happens to be a genius.
(Sarcastic Voice) Newton gets all the credit!
No, do you know what I mean?
(Sarcastic Voice) For his laws of the universe!
Well, other people were workin' whilst he was havin' a lunch break--
